content.question: The David Vases are significant in the history of Chinese art primarily because

choices.label: the elephant-head handles document the derivation of their forms from bronze objects
their blue color suggests that the vases were intended to serve as gifts to the Mughal court
their inscriptions make them one of the earliest dated examples of blue-and-white porcelain
the use of cobalt for the blue glaze provides evidence of trade between China and the Middle East

content.answer: their inscriptions make them one of the earliest dated examples of blue-and-white porcelain
